answers.answer: Hello,This results mean you are diabetic.You need to get a blood sugar monitoring kit and start testing 1 1/2 - 2 hours after eating and also fasting numbers and recording them.With your current levels diet and exercise may or may not be enough to get your numbers down to normal (fasting < 95, post eating < 100-120).  You may also need medication.If you are not overweight / are active, ask your doctor to test for diabetes antibodies.  You may also possibly be adult type 1.What to do?1. Lose weight if you are overweight.2. Exercise every day - minimum of 30 minutes aerobic, but more if you can.3. Low carb diet (avoid sugars, fruits juices, anything with sugars added, strictly limit grains, get most of your carbs from vegetables).  You can use the meter to see the effect of eating different foods and then you can modify your diet based on the results you get.4. If the above doesn't get your numbers down enough, then you should be put on Glucophage / metformin.5. monitor closely.  You are still pretty young for this and it is best if you can control it well now.
